metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29374 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.7.3, related to mm/gup.c and mm/huge_memory.c. The get_user_pages (aka gup) implementation, when used for a copy-on-write page, does not properly consider the semantics of read operations and therefore can grant unintended write access, aka CID-17839856fd58. It was discovered that the memory management subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly handle copy-on-write operations in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to gain unintended write access to read-only memory pages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-aws - 4.4.0-1086.90
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-azure - 4.15.0-1108.120~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-203-generic - 4.4.0-203.235~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-203-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-203.235~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-203-lowlatency - 4.4.0-203.235~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1086.90').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.120~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-203.235~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.120~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-203.235~14.04.1').
